summary: This document is a series of FBI internal email logs from the New York office, dated between July 2020 and November 2020. It details ongoing evidence review, preparation, and assistance activities for the investigations into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, including tasks like converting DVDs, redacting images for discovery, and conducting photo scrubs.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the ongoing FBI investigation, with evidence review and case preparation activities being conducted.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named alongside Epstein as the subject of the FBI investigation, with specific tasks like assisting with her investigation and evidence review.

connections.description: Repeatedly mentioned together as the joint subjects of the FBI investigation (Epstein/Maxwell), indicating their cases are linked.

events.title: Research for Epstein hearing
events.description: FBI conducted research, assistance, and preparation for a hearing related to the Epstein investigation, including binder review.

events.title: DVD evidence conversion
events.description: An FBI SOS (Specialist or Support) assisted a Special Agent in a lab to convert DVDs recovered as evidence into the FBI's system for review and analysis.

events.title: Image redaction for discovery
events.description: FBI personnel assisted with redacting images for discovery purposes as part of the evidence review for the Epstein/Maxwell case.

events.title: Photo scrub for Epstein case
events.description: An FBI Special Agent conducted a 'photo scrub' for the Epstein case, a process likely involving reviewing and analyzing photographic evidence.

keyFacts: The FBI's New York office was actively reviewing evidence for the Epstein and Maxwell investigations throughout 2020.
Evidence processing included converting physical DVDs to digital format and redacting images for legal discovery.
The document references a specific FBI case number: SOD-NY-3027571, used for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
Activities were classified as UNCLASSIFIED//FOUO (For Official Use Only) and subject to a protective order.
The logs show a continuous, multi-month effort involving research, evidence review, and preparation for legal proceedings.
